alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Dubois; Orange (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 07 at 3:25AM EST until March 07 at 3:45AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM EST FOR SOUTHEASTERN DUBOIS...NORTHWESTERN CRAWFORD AND SOUTHWESTERN ORANGE COUNTIES... At 325 AM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles southeast of Jasper, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... English, Birdseye, Riceville, Celestine, Ethel, Saint Marks, Taswell, Mentor, Eckerty and Mifflin. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 AM EST for south central Indiana. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure.
